group_1.narration: In Kosho Ward studios,@the men stay at the studio while@the women take care of the housework.
Those old, outdated traditions are slowly@but surely destroying my body and spirit.

group_1.textCenter: Well, that should be enough groceries for@a little while.
Next I have to take care of the laundry while@getting dinner ready at the same time...
If I hang the clothes while dinner cooks...@Yeah, I should be able to do my homework!

group_1.narration: There are coins in the pockets?!@These must be Take's pants...
Oh, and this pocket has tissues inside.@These are probably Ryou's...
I wish they'd consider how much work@it is doing the laundry...
Grin and bear it, Tsukasa!@Okay, here's the last of it!

group_1.textCenter: Great, now I can tackle my homework before@Dad and the others finish working...

group_1.textLeft: Huh?! Aren't you home a little early?!

group_1.textRight: Everyone did so well today that I decided@we could all eat a little early.
We'll do the rest in the evening.
As the daughter of this esteemed studio, you@should be able to anticipate this much...

group_1.textLeft: (How was I supposed to know that...)
(I can't entertain every whim that floats@through their heads. That's impossible.)
(I have respect for Dad, but this is...)

group_1.narration: No, stop it, I shouldn't say it...

group_1.textLeft: This wouldn't happen if you helped out@a little around the house, Dad!
That's what you always come back with!
That's why Mom left, isn't it?!

group_1.textRight: Er, Tsukasa... I could help you out...

group_1.narration: Day in, day out, endless chores...@With all the people here, it's insane.
There's no way I can get through work@like this with just a smile.@It's making me lose sight of myself.
Whenever I felt myself slipping away,@the one thing that gave me peace was@the flute I received when I was very young.
If I got too sad or depressed,@if the anger overtook me,@I would go to play my flute.
It's the only way I could unwind@since I had no time to hang out with friends.
